sections.title: Project Context & Roles
sections.goal: Understand participant roles, responsibilities, and the Phoenix Feature Store's objectives within the Build phase.
sample_questions: Can you walk me through your role in the Phoenix Feature Store project?
How does the Build phase shape your day-to-day priorities?
What are the main objectives and success criteria for this phase?

sections.title: Technical Architecture & UX Touchpoints
sections.goal: Explore how the feature store's architecture supports both MLOps workflows and end-user (data scientist) experience.
sample_questions: How is the online/offline serving layer structured to meet latency requirements?
What are typical interaction points for data scientists, and how intuitive are they?
Can you describe how drift monitoring results are surfaced to users?

sections.title: Integration with Upstream and Downstream Systems
sections.goal: Identify dependencies and data flows between Phoenix and other systems like Helios Datalake or Mercury Messaging.
sample_questions: Which upstream data sources feed into Phoenix, and how do you manage schema changes?
How do downstream ML model services consume features from Phoenix?
Have you encountered cross-system latency or consistency issues?

sections.title: Risk Management & Compliance
sections.goal: Discuss how the project handles risks, especially around drift detection, data privacy, and SLA adherence.
sample_questions: What risks are you most concerned about in feature delivery?
How do you ensure compliance with internal policies like POL-SEC-001?
What’s your mitigation plan if drift thresholds are exceeded?

sections.title: Decision-Making & Tradeoffs
sections.goal: Understand key architectural or process decisions, tradeoffs made, and evidence used to support them.
sample_questions: Can you share a recent decision where you had to balance serving latency vs. feature freshness?
What evidence or metrics did you use to decide?
How did stakeholders react to that tradeoff?

sections.title: Future Outlook & Lessons Learned
sections.goal: Capture reflections on what’s working, what could improve, and the vision for the Phoenix Feature Store.
sample_questions: What have been your biggest lessons learned so far?
How do you see Phoenix evolving over the next year?
If you could change one thing in the process or architecture, what would it be?
